intro: Craniolaria annua, commonly known as the annual craniolaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is a small herbaceous species that typically grows in moist, sandy soils in coastal areas. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It blooms during the summer months and is often found in regions with a temperate climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in certain parts of the world.
